The bondsman grants additional abilities to for the wizard that likes to rely on an arcane talisman. The familiarist builds a supernatural bond with his chosen familiar. And the secondus can be seen as the Jack of All trades in the wizardry world.

214615.name: Of Monstrous Mien
214615.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Pages for Shadow of the Demon Lord!

The misbegotten hybrids of strange unions, the results of bizarre conjurations, creatures warped through experimentation, alchemical effluvia, or the corrupting taint of the Void, monsters are often unique beings. Few monsters are members of entirely new species though some species have their origins in such beasts. Usually prone to fits of violent rage, monsters are driven by hunger, brutal instinct, and all-too-commonly pain wrought by their unnatural creation or existence. Whether found in the forsaken wilds, hidden laboratories, or areas polluted by alchemical toxins, most are thankfully solitary. Only in rare instances are several identical monsters created, those capable of fighting as a pack most likely to cooperate with each other.

Of Monstrous Mien builds on the information presented in Shadow of the Demon Lord by presenting a set of tools for customizing and building your own monsters. You will find all the basic monsters and tables to support their customization, which let you randomly determine the form and appearance of monsters, customizing the basic entries, though you can always choose results to suit your taste and needs for the story.

214616.name: Sundered Epoch: Generations - Core Rules v5
214616.description:
From publisher blurb:

An era of conflict; an age of turmoil – a Sundered Epoch.

The Sundered Epoch: Generations (SEG) is a role-playing game designed to emulate an “action hero” style of fiction. It is a universal system designed to be as flexible as you are.

This is the Fifth Edition of the SEG system. With this new version we have taken the system to a new level and have added optional rules that were previously considered “advanced” and combined rules that have become staples in most of our play-testing sessions.

214617.name: Non-Human Species (v5)
214617.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here's the guidelines used for generating non-human creatures. These are preview rules for Non-humans as used in the upcoming book, No Man's Land, for use with the Sundered Epoch: Generations RPG.

214618.name: Adventure Starter: Flight of the Medusa
214618.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Adventure Starter is intended for a group of 3-6 Eastside Project agents of Heroic experience.

In Dimension 19, Prescidia, a pregnant gorgon, was hunted by Morgan Moriarti when she fled into a cave. In the darkness she saw light and stumbled into a nest of Dimensional Spiders that had created a bridge to our dimension.

The following is an Adventure Starter for use with the Sundered Epoch: Generations role-playing game in the No Man’s Land setting.

214619.name: Adventure Starter: Meet the Spartans
214619.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Adventure Starter is intended for a group of 3-6 Eastside Project agents of Heroic experience.

A couple of Spartans (vigilantes or solo Slayers) have been crossing the country killing Outsiders and narrowly escaping law enforcement. Their actions are causing problems for the Eastside Project as they are being forced to deploy their Cleanup Crews to cover up their crimes. This is becoming problematic.

The Spartans are investigating an illness that has spread at a local elementary school. Three children have already died and several others are deathly ill and doctors have no idea the cause.

The following is an Adventure Starter for use with the Sundered Epoch: Generations role-playing game in the No Man’s Land setting.

214620.name: Sanity
214620.description:
From publisher blurb:

Eventually the mind breaks down and characters will begin to suffer from post-traumatic stress. These are preview rules for Sanity as used in the upcoming book, No Man's Land, for use with the Sundered Epoch: Generations RPG.

214621.name: Magic (Beta 2)
214621.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wizards, priests, druids, oh my! These are preview rules for Magic as used in the upcoming book, No Man's Land, for use with the Sundered Epoch: Generations RPG.

214622.name: Hounds Affiliation Guide
214622.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hounds, otherwise known as TRAC Elite, is the secret program organized by the US government to detain and control hostile AMPs and force them to do "good" in the world. In the process, some have gone on to great public notoriety, while others are forgotten entirely, lost to a machine that eats up the undesirables. Affiliation Guide: Hounds takes you deep into this group, revealing its shadowy corner of the world. Who knows? This information might save your life one day.

Includes:

Breakdown on the Hound experience
Updated Character: The Lance (Hound Version)
New Hound-Only Powers: Collar-Acclimation
Complete Adventure: Loose Ends

214624.name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Rick on Horse Game Booster
214624.description:
Nothing could stop Rick Grimes, a small town police officer, from reuniting with his family. Not a gunshot wound to the chest, nor waking from a coma into a world overrun with the dead, nor a lonely and harrowing journey through the Walker-infested streets of Atlanta.

This booster pack contains 2 Unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Rick on Horseback to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your herd.

Requires The Walking Dead: All Out War Miniatures Game Core set to play.

Contents
1 Rick on Horse Miniature
1 Walker Miniature
2 Character Cards
4 Equipment Cards
1 Mantic Point

214625.name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Morgan Game Booster
214625.description:
Morgan Jones and his son Duane were Rick's first human contact after he returned home. What Rick found was Duane's shovel! Morgan and Duane then accompanied Rick to the Cynthiana Police Dept. where they were outfitted with rifles and bullets.

This booster pack contains 3 Unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Morgan and Duane to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your herd.

Requires The Walking Dead: All Out War Miniatures Game Core set to play.

Contents
1 Morgan Miniature
1 Duane Miniature
1 Walker Miniature
2 Character Cards
4 Equipment Cards
1 Mantic Point

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214627.name: The Fate of Alain
214627.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

A trip to the Loftwood to help secure the territory of House Bredivan leads to an unusual revelation. Is it true? Can Alain really be alive? There’s really only one way to find out...

A one-round Regional adventure set in Ratik for characters level 1 - 9.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214628.name: A Knightly Tale
214628.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

Festival weeks in Ratik are marked by grand tourneys sponsored by noble houses. This year’s major tournament for Brewfest 596CY is to be held in Ratikhill. Her Ladyship Abril of House Bresht has sponsored a sub-tourney for squires, opening the possibilities of glory and gold.

A one-round Regional adventure set in Ratik for characters level 1 - 7.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214629.name: Court and Causality
214629.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

Fate is a funny thing. One day you are travelling along a muddy road minding your own business. The next you are moving in social circles of the elite and powerful.

After helping a man with a lame horse on the muddy roads of Ratik, the PCs find themselves invited to attend a Baronial Banquet as his personal guests. For some this is an opportunity to climb the social ladder, for some it is a chance to make new alliances while for others it is merely the opportunity to eat well and drink deeply at someone else’s expense.

All that can be certain is that a night at the baronial court is a night to remember.

Part Two of the Fractured Crown series.

A one-round Regional adventure set in court of Her Excellency, the Arch-Baroness in Ratik for characters level 1-7.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214630.name: Those At Sea
214630.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

Over the years the relationship between Ratik and the Schnai has fluctuated between a chilly peace and open warfare. Lexnol originally brokered the peace, and the Schnai would only deal with him. Since he has been incapacitated no dialogue has been able to take place. But now one Schnai chieftain seems open to dealings with other Ratikans. The negotiations will begin with a journey on the sea...

A one round nautical adventure (that means at least one character should be able to handle a boat) set in the waters off the Archbarony of Ratik for characters levelled 1-7.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214631.name: Plain Sailing
214631.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

What could be simpler? Take a short trip into the Loftwood, collect a tree, bring it back to Fadric. Easy money. What could possibly go wrong?

A one-round Regional adventure set in Ratik for characters of first level only.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214632.name: Marner: Taxing Times
214632.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Introductory Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

Marner may be the capital of a Nation in crisis, but the wheels of bureaucracy grind ever-onwards, and now that the harvests are in, the tax collectors are sniffing around, demanding the Archbaron's share. The city is packed with people, paying tithes, trading harvests, purchasing supplies for the winter, or simply avoiding their duties. But can you avoid them all?

For PCs without a sense of Duty, one will be issued on arrival.

A one-round Regional Introductory adventure set in Ratik for characters level 1 only.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214633.name: The Price of Knowledge
214633.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

Harkam Chillgreen, a halfling importer/exporter of unusual wares has goods that need transporting from Ratikhill to the dwarves of Aurichold. Due to the lateness of the season, the itinerant dwarven population has already returned home, so Chillgreen is looking for hardy adventurers to transport the goods for him. Will you accept the challenge of a trip into the Rakers this late in the season? And what can be so important that the dwarves need it before winter sets in?

A mostly outdoors Ratik Regional Introductory Scenario for 1st level characters only.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214634.name: Sacred Ground
214634.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

An alliance of Pyremius-worshipping orcs are mustering in the Rakers and nobody knows what they will do next. But Sir Hengon Mogotten is sending you on a strictly need-to-know mission, deep under cover into the camp of the Pyremius worshipping orcs. You’re going to have to get in, find out as much as you can, cause as much havoc as possible and get out before your time is up. There are no guarantees on this mission as Sir Hengon Mogotten is putting you directly in harm’s way for the good of the Archbarony.

A one-round Ratik regional adventure for characters level 3-15 set in the Archbarony of Ratik.

Part three of the Rakers Aflame series, this adventure leads directly into the special interactive RTK8-I01 Cleansing Fire.

Players will be given an opportunity to change characters during the Introduction if they feel their character is completely unsuited to the adventure.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214635.name: Confrontation in the Timberway
214635.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

Who is responsible for what is happening in the Timberway? Strange events seem to be coming from House Keth land, can Lady Keth be ignorant of it all? Perhaps someone should find out. Intrigue, politics, a tourney and a final confrontation.

A one-round Regional adventure set in Ratik for characters level 3 - 15.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214636.name: Circles
214636.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

Round and round, spinning in the dark. Many little lights but none of them a spark that can light the way forward or back from whence she came. Who sets the rules and who calls this a game?

An investigative one-round regional adventure set in Ratik, primarily concerning Clan Ukaloa and Houses Abonhoth and Keth, for characters of level 1 - 11.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214637.name: A Deeper Darkness
214637.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

The humanoids of the Bone March have taken advantage of the dispersal of the Ratikan armed forces into the Rakers to combat the menace of the Pyremius-worshipping orcs. A large force of goblinoids and gnolls from Spinecastle has been reported marching through the Kalmar Pass towards Ratik. All that stands before them are the remnants of the Ratikhill garrison and the redoubtable dwarves of Aurichold. Can you and the dwarves delay the armies of the Bone March long enough for the forces of Ratikhill to regroup to defend the Pass? The dwarves of Aurichold don’t seem too co-operative.

A one-round Ratik regional adventure set in (and under) the Rakers Mountains for characters level 4-16.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214638.name: The Mark of Keenan
214638.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

A letter from a condemned prisoner offers you a chance to right the wrongs of the past. But with hours remaining before the execution is to take place, you may already be too late.

This adventure is a direct sequel to the adventure RTK7-07: Lost at Sea, and for best enjoyment Lost at Sea should be played before this adventure is played.

A one-round regional adventure set in Ratik for characters level 3 - 13.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214639.name: Lost at Sea
214639.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

Somewhere off the coast of Marner, a caravel has been lost at sea. No survivors have been located, and the whereabouts of the vessel is unknown. The Maninot family has called for assistance in locating their ship and ascertaining the fate of it and those who sailed upon her.

A one-round Regional adventure set in and around Marner in the Archbarony of Ratik for characters level 1 - 11. Not for those with a dislike of the ocean.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214640.name: Thin Air
214640.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Meta-Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

In the shadow of the Rakers, strange events are afoot. A whole village has gone missing and no one knows how or why. Can someone get to the bottom of this mystery?

A one-round Regional adventure set in the Archbarony of Ratik for characters level 1-11.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214641.name: The Slaughtered Unicorn
214641.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Meta-Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

On a visit to Harrins Glen, renowned for producing some of the best ale, whisky and wine for the area, you find a most unusual site. What is it and can you solve the problem for the people of Harrins Glen?

A one-round Regional adventure set near Loegrimm of Ratik, for characters level 1-11.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214642.name: Strange Days in the Timberways
214642.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Meta-Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

The Timberway keeps its secrets well but now those secrets are starting to emerge. Strange and bizarre creatures are coming out of the Timberway and people are beginning to notice. Why is this happening and what is behind it? Some important figures want you to find out.

A one-round Regional adventure set in Ratik for characters level 1 - 11.

Part One of the Heart of the Timberway.

214643.name: Worlds of Pulp: Classic Collection Volume I
214643.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add villains from the golden age of comic books to your Worlds of Pulp, using the Bare Bones Beyond rules mechanic by Scaldcrow Games (The Original Bare Bones System)

This Flavor Booster is also a Primer for the New Worlds of Pulp With Added Crunch mechanic Get a first hand look at a few of the new rules that takes our already innovative but simple mechanic and elevates it to new levels of fun!

What this books contains:

Statistics on Golden Age heroes and villains, such as: Ace of Blades, Alias X, Black Cobra, Black Commander, and the Strangler
A first look at our incredible new Added Crunch rules
Updated statistics for each of the primary characters from Davey Beauchamp's Amazing Pulp Adventures and Rotwang City.




Bonus cooperative board game! The game uses art and basic design from an early issue of Boy Comics. Our version is called Charge Against Tyrannt. Three prominent heroes (Mister Adventure, Crimson Moth, and Black Cobra) participate in a charge to sack Nazi Swisslakia (Country in the Scaldcrow Universe).

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214644.name: Open Waters
214644.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Meta-Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

Attending a small jousting meet on the borders of Cormik and Abonhoth lands, you are asked to meet a ship and retrieve an important parcel. However on arrival not everything is as ordered.

A challenging land based Ratik regional scenario for characters level 1 - 15.

Part two of the Rakers Aflame series.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214645.name: Warrior's Moon
214645.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Meta-Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

When you are asked to acquire antiquities, most adventurers fall into the "smash and grab" variety. If the antiquities are the mortal remains of a hero of the realm, finesse may be a better option. An investigative adventure seeking to unlock riddles of history during Richfest 597 CY.

A one-round Regional adventure set in Ratik for characters level 4 - 11.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214646.name: Horror in the Timberway
214646.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Meta-Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

Something horrible is happening in the Timberway and while some of this evil has been discovered, more must be uncovered. Unspeakable crimes, hideous happenings and unnatural foulness that chills the blood of even the most hardened adventurer – all this must be revealed before the healing of the Timberway can begin. This adventure contains strong horror elements, so player discretion is advised.

A one-round Regional adventure set in Ratik for characters level 3 - 15.

214647.name: Æthercoil (Issue 3 - Nov 2016)
214647.description:
(publisher blurb)

Document Contents

First idea for Evolving Artifacts
Using Storm King's Thunder's Runes as expendable Magic Items
Expanding on the Revised Ranger's Companion Mechanic
Expanding more on the Witch Class
The Archivist and Archeologist classes
Three Prestige classes, including a Bladesinger variant
Various worldbuilding notes, and parts of the PH Wiki

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214648.name: Nobility at Needlepoint
214648.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Meta-Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

After bearing a marriage proposal and expensive gifts from a besotted knight, to a girl at an exclusive school for Ratik's noble daughters, you are invited to stay for a small dance. A warm welcome indeed. And yet – is it just your imagination, or is it getting colder in here? If you uncover secrets, you may have to decide – which ones do you keep?

A one-round regional adventure, with an extended play option, set in Ratik for characters level 1 - 15.

214649.name: Enascentia: Touch of Flame
214649.description:
From publisher blurb:

Suddenly the surface of the lake starts swirling, as if moved by a gentle breeze, and in a few moments it is covered with a rainbow of thousand different colors: it must be the famous Garomsha Fire, happening this very night! But, as if this were not enough, you hear a strong, thundering voice on the lake’s shore, near the start of the path leading to the village...

Touch of Flame is an Enascentia-Shaintar crossover adventure for 4-6 Novice adventurers by Sean Patrick Fannon

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214650.name: Sceptre of Power
214650.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Meta-Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

The passing of the seasons is of great significance to the people of Ratik. Any celebration involving Wenta is particularly popular. Why then does that priestess of Wenta approaching your table look so worried?

An introductory Regional adventure set in Fadric for first level characters only.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214651.name: Gnomes, Badgers and Crabs
214651.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Meta-Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

You are looking forward to putting your feet up after completing a simple guard job escorting dwarven goods to the gnome town of Daebersted when you hear of a plea for help from the gnome village of Baerlen deep in the Lofthills.

A one-round Regional introductory adventure set in Ratik for 4-6 characters of first level.

rpgseries: RTK - Living Greyhawk Ratik Regional Adventure
214652.name: Where the Halflings Roam
214652.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Meta-Regional Adventure set in Ratik

From the introduction:

A caravan of halflings needs those skilled in battle to guard their precious supplies as they travel to Optwall, the chosen site for a new halfling settlement to be built. Simple enough, Right? Protect the goods, keep the halflings alive, and get paid. Meanwhile join the halflings on a free tour of Ratik, taking in the odd fair and perhaps even see a joust or two. How hard could it possibly be?

A two-round Regional adventure set in Ratik for characters of level 1.

214653.name: Sarhemoth
214653.description:
From Introduction:

A Slumbering Idol

At the top of the world, buried under snow and ice and the obscurity of time that itself flows like the mightiest of glaciers, lies an ancient temple. Built for the singular purpose of containing the only item inside its walls, this temple is crudely fashioned, with rather few decorations. The golden idol inside it looks quite different. Though gruesome, with a squat, misshapen body, its features are exquisitely realistic. Its muscular, quadrupedal body, bedecked with tentacles, vestigial wings, and a head that resembles the head of several animals squashed together, veritably seethes with lifelike energy.

It is not a deceiving artistry, this appearance, for the idol is no sculpture. It is one aspect of the Hemoth, the divine force that shaped the multiverse into its current form, cursed to inactivity in this immobile form. Where the other aspects are the ones that built the walls between the planes, solidifying their differences and preventing living beings from crossing over between them, this idol is the Sarhemoth, the one that destroyed the multiverse that came before. And if disturbed, it will return to life.

Known to the ancients who had not yet succumbed to historical amnesia as the Four-Mawed Trumpeter of the End, the Emerald Flame, and the Blind Horse with Many Eyes that Tramples the World in Its Wake, the Sarhemoth would have destroyed all of Creation if it had not been imprisoned here in this temple. It has been much reduced in power since the multiverse as it is today was created, and perhaps it will never return to its original glory, for other aspects of the Hemoth have themselves been laid low — but then again, perhaps it will.

Or perhaps the world will never find it? Perhaps there will never be a band of power-hungry, foolhardy adventurers who cross the miles of frozen wasteland to find this temple and its golden idol. Perhaps no one will ever see that metallic patina fade away, will never see that head swell and grow twice or thrice as large, its myriad turquoise eyes opening to gaze upon the world it will soon destroy. Perhaps.

214654.name: Sarhemoth
214654.description:
From Introduction:

A Slumbering Idol

At the top of the world, buried under snow and ice and the obscurity of time that itself flows like the mightiest of glaciers, lies an ancient temple. Built for the singular purpose of containing the only item inside its walls, this temple is crudely fashioned, with rather few decorations. The golden idol inside it looks quite different. Though gruesome, with a squat, misshapen body, its features are exquisitely realistic. Its muscular, quadrupedal body, bedecked with tentacles, vestigial wings, and a head that resembles the head of several animals squashed together, veritably seethes with lifelike energy.

It is not a deceiving artistry, this appearance, for the idol is no sculpture. Where the other aspects are the ones that built the walls between the planes, solidifying their differences and preventing living beings from crossing over between them, this idol is the Sarhemoth, the one that destroyed the multiverse that came before. And if disturbed, it will return to life.

Known to the ancients who had not yet succumbed to historical amnesia as the Four-Mawed Trumpeter of the End, the Emerald Flame, and the Blind Horse with Many Eyes that Tramples the World in Its Wake, the Sarhemoth would have destroyed all of Creation if it had not been imprisoned here in this temple. Or perhaps the world will never find it? Perhaps there will never be a band of power-hungry, foolhardy adventurers who cross the miles of frozen wasteland to find this temple and its golden idol. Perhaps no one will ever see that metallic patina fade away, will never see that head swell and grow twice or thrice as large, its myriad turquoise eyes opening to gaze upon the world it will soon destroy. Perhaps.

214656.name: The Good Architect
214656.description:
Description from the publisher:

Bring the architectural history of the Western world to your tabletop with this competitive set collection game for 2-8 players. Every play feels different than the last, with 284 cards the starting combinations are nearly countless. Compete to assemble the highest scoring building by collecting cards from 8 architecturally significant eras and styles from Mesopotamia, ancient Egypt, classical Greece, and the Renaissance! Boost your craftsmanship, material quality, and building’s propriety to increase your final score. The more cards you add to your building the more notable you become, and the more points you will score.

Notable archaeologists help uncover things once lost. Navigate demanding clients, natural disasters, and influential historic architects wanting to make their mark on your project. Mount Vesuvius erupts, a plague wipes out your workforce, Michelangelo contributes to your design, anything can happen! The one who can maneuver these obstacles and create the best building is, until the next round, the good architect.

214658.description:
The Skavenblight Scramblers Dice Set

Set includes 7 Blood Bowl dice:

Blocking Dice x3
d6 x2
d8 x1
d12 x1
214658.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): The Skavenblight Scramblers Dice Set

214659.name: Bloodshadows Third Edition
214659.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's a mean old word out there!
The spellslinger upstairs conjures too loud.
That stiff you left in the alley is walking again.
Your client skipped town before paying.
And your landlord is looking for his rent.

Bloodshadows combines pulp adventure with dark fantasy and noir stylings. Tough detectives in weathered trenchcoats swap biting comments with vampires in evening gowns. Humans walk the dark streets of the city alongside demonic breeds and long-dead ghouls. Magic is everywhere, even if just to light a cigarette. Death waits around every corner--undeath sometimes follows. The Wilderness holds even more danger, kept at bay only by city gates and those who patrol them. It's a dark, brooding world filled with shadows and wonders.

This is a complete roleplaying game that utilizes an easy to learn system, which is also versatile and quick-playing. All the rules needed to create characters, resolve conflicts, cast spells, and design fantasy-noir adventures are included. Featuring:

16 player species, ranging from Humans and half-breeds to shifters and undead.
8 schools of magic that anyone can learn, including 194 spells (plus 15 cantrips that are commonplace).
5 theories of magic that characters can use to create their own new spells.
2 adventures: The Lady is a Vamp and Trail of Riches.
Optional rules like bleeding, grittier health, and alternate magic feedback help customize the game to your needs.
Use experience to increase the odds, better resist damage, or introduce new subplots (optional)
Use exploits to enhance your success, like increasing damage or affecting multiple targets.
Look for clues, use your connections, and give chase in the streets on foot, horseback, or by car.
Conversion notes from genreDiversion i/Ghostories/Mean Streets, Bloodshadows Classic/MasterBook, and Pacesetter System™ (Cryptworld™, Majus™, Rotworld™). Use with Active Exploits for Diceless play.

214662.name: Treasures of Lutello
214662.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Swords & Wizardry Mini-Dungeon
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 3-5

The jester Lutello now lays entombed along with treasures inherited from his eccentric lord. The jester’s crypt however isn’t what it appears to be. And neither are the treasures...

Treasures of Lutello is part of a series of mini-dungeons designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side quests or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

214663.name: Black Pudding #1
214663.description:
From publisher blurb:

Glorping and shlorping along, the Black Pudding zlorts upon your party! What do you do? Read it, of course. This is an OSR-style zine of RPG goodies rendered in a highly visual style. Within these 24 ooze-soaked pages you'll find magic swords that make cuts no one can heal, monsters that shoot gold pieces, black knights, catgirls, chainmail chicks, and evil temples!

Contents:

2 character sheets
7 character classes
2 one-page dungeons
9 monsters
1 book of new spells
8 NPCs
House rules and tons of art!

214664.name: Rabbits & Rangers
214664.description:
From publisher blurb:

Remember when four-fingered talking animals wielded magic swords, cast spells, and fought demons? No? Well grab your Labyrinth Lord and dice because you're about to enter a world of properly wild critter crawls! Herein you will find rules for running funny animal campaigns including rabbits, ducks, mice, lions, bears, fossas, and many more!

Rabbits & Rangers is a supplement written for Labyrinth Lord describing 50 cartoon animal races and various rules tweaks that let you get a slightly more cartoony vibe out of your game. Fully illustrated, this book also contains new spells, monsters, and magic items. I mean, who couldn't use a Ring of Ahkme that will let you mail order any device required to achieve your genius goals?

214665.name: Druid: Druid Circles
214665.description:
Publisher blurb:

New options sprout for the druid this week: three new Druid Circle options and an optional rule for gaining different beast shapes for Wild Shape. We invite you to read the options' descriptions, make characters with them, and see whether you like them.

214667.name: Soul Puzzler
214667.description:
Soul Puzzler is a 2-player, head to head tile placement game inspired by the puzzle based video games of the 90's to now. Similar enough to another classic, popular game, Soul Puzzler is easily accessible to all players. However, it has layers of depth that will please the more experienced gamer.

During each turn a player may take one of two actions, that of playing a Soul Token or switching an existing Soul Token's Position. Once the Soul Token is placed or a Soul Token is switched, the turn then goes to the next player. When you have 3, 4, or 5 of your Soul Tokens in a Row or Column, you remove them and score points equal to the number of tokens you remove. All Tokens above the removed Soul Tokens fall to the bottom most portion of the board. The first player to reach 15 points wins.

214668.name: Lucy & Pogo
214668.description:
Count the claws, sort the letters and play on a dog piano. With "Lucy & Pogo" kids learn in beautifully told stories how to overcome prejudices and how important it is to be tolerant and open to new things. Educative and fun for kids 3-7!

Source: The Publisher Website.

214669.name: Archipelago
214669.description:
Players: 2-4 players, ages 6 and up

Playing time: 10-30 minutes

Materials: A "hexhex" board, i.e. a hexagonal shaped board composed of hexagonal cells (various sizes are possible; 6-8 cells per side is recommended); and playing pieces in two to four colors. (To play all permutations of player numbers and board sizes would require approximately 85 pieces in one color, 85 pieces in a second color, 55 pieces in a third color, and 45 pieces in a fourth color.)

Basic idea: In Archipelago, players try to create more islands (i.e. groups of two or more adjacent pieces) than opponents create.


RULES

A group ("island") is a connected set of two or more same-colored stones. Each player is the owner of a single color of stone. An island in a given color will count toward its color-owner's score, regardless of whether the color-owner or an opponent created that island.

Players are allowed three stone placements per turn. (Exception: the first player in a two player game plays just two stones on his/her very first turn. See the section SPECIAL RULES BY PLAYER NUMBER below.) These three stones can be ANY color (i.e. on your turn, you needn't play any of your own color of stones if you don't wish to; you can play any color or any mix of colors in a single turn). A stone can be played to any empty cell; once placed, stones do not move.

Additionally, a player is permitted to play a bonus stone (of any color of his/her choice) for every opponent who is strictly ahead of him/her in the current group score; each player's "group score" = the number of distinct groups in his/her color. (Note that when using a score track, the number of bonus stones you are allowed is always equal to the number of opponent stones strictly ahead of you on the track at the start of your turn.)

Bonus stone examples: In a two player game, the trailing player gets one bonus stone and thus plays 4 stones to the board (the default three stones + the bonus stone). In a three player game with each player having a distinct number of groups, the second-place player plays 4 stones and the last-place player plays 5 stones. In a three player game with two players tied for first-place, the last-place player plays 5 stones. In a three player game with two players tied for last-place, each last-place player plays 4 stones.

When the board is full, or when all players have consecutively passed their turns, the game ends. The winning order is determined by the greatest number of groups. In the case of a tie, the tied player who was most recently in the lead is the winner. (This status can be very easily tracked on a score board – see the score boards available in the instruction set that is downloadable in the file section of this page.)

Tie break examples:
• Players A and B are tied at the game's end with four groups each. Player A never had more than four groups, but at one point earlier in the game Player B had five groups, which A subsequently reduced back to four groups via sabotage, i.e. by playing a stone in B's color to join two of B's formerly distinct groups. Player B wins on the tie break, since B was most recently ahead of A.
• Players A and B are tied at the game's end with five groups each, whereas C has six groups. C is thus the winner, with A and B tied for second place. Earlier in the game both A and B had six groups. B went down from six groups to five before A did, meaning that A wins second place.


SPECIAL RULES BY PLAYER NUMBER

TWO PLAYERS:

To neutralize the first player advantage, the first player plays only two stones on his her turn. Thereafter players play three on stones on each of their turns (plus any bonus stones they are entitled to).

THREE PLAYERS

Each player, even the first player, plays three stones per turn (plus any bonus stones). There is no need to neutralize the first player advantage since the remaining players can be counted on to act together in a temporary alliance to neutralize any such advantage.

However, the following "Frozen Irrelevance" rule is recommended:

o Frozen Irrelevance: When the board arrangement is such that a player's current rank (e.g. 1st, 2nd, or 3rd) is unalterable by any further play from any player, then that player's rank has assumed its final form, and he/she is "frozen" from further play. That is, he/she takes no further part in the game, and the game play continues on with just the non-frozen players.

FOUR PLAYERS

With four players, each player (including the first player) plays only TWO stones per turn (plus bonus stones). Also, "Frozen Irrelevance" is recommended. Finally, use just a 0.5 bonus stone for each player you strictly trail (rounding up).


VARIATIONS

• Bonus stones: Consider awarding no bonus stones at all. Alternatively (in a 3 player game), consider awarding just a 0.5 stone bonus for each opponent whom you strictly trail (rounding up).

• Default number of stones: The 2-3 player game may be adjusted by lowering the default number of stones per turn from 3 stones to 2 stones per turn. The 4 player game can be tried with 3 stones per turn.

• Opening protocol: In a 2 player game, use a different opening protocol, namely, the first player on his/her first turn places just one stone, the second player on his/her first turn places two stones, and thereafter the default for each player is three stones (plus any bonus stones). Also, you can experiment with various opening stone protocols in the 3 and 4 player versions, if desired.

214670.name: Plague Road
214670.description:
User Summary

Set around a city being consumed from within by a disease, Plague Road tells a story of a lone doctor who once abandoned their home and now returns in search of those who have survived. Over the course of the game, players will learn how the city fell victim to the sickness growing within its walls, why the Plague Doctor left, and what brought them back in a tale of regret and redemption.

214673.description:
The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire - Missile Crisis is a promotional card for The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire, originally unlocked as a stretch reward for backers of the Kickstarter project.

The card reads:

No environmental row is scored; instead, each player immediately scores 1 VP per space their United Nations marker has moved. Then, all three structure markets are refreshed.

Until the next Global Impact card is triggered, players may not advance further on the United Nations track.
214673.name: The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire – Missile Crisis

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214675.name: Principality of Ulek
214675.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the premier dwarven nation of the Flanaess. Here you will find yourself tested every day in our war torn lands. Our great nation stands against the greatest foe the Sheldomar Valley has ever seen. The Pomarj, a humanoid nation, has carved out a large country for themselves at the expense of our own lands. During the Great War with Iuz the Old to the north, we supplied those great nations opposing him with our best troops. During that time, Turrosh Mak and his humanoid scum struck at us from the east and forced us to retreat back to the Lortmil hills. Having lost all of the lands from the Lortmil hills to the Jewel River to this plague of humanoids has caused our nation to focus on rebuilding our strength. We have fortified our position in the hills to stanch the flow of humanoids into our country. Join us in the fight to retake our disputed lands and to destroy the plague of humanoids that have infested the eastern half of our country.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214676.name: Find My Son!
214676.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Scenario

From the introduction:

A quiet day of shopping is interrupted by the please of a father looking for his missing son.

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214677.name: Spies Like Us
214677.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Scenario

From the introduction:

You are asked to help locate three halfling scouts who have gone missing. What information they have gathered will only be found if you can save them in time.

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214678.name: Crypt of Promise
214678.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Scenario

From the introduction:

Asked to investigate an ancient Dwarven vault recently found by Ulek scouts, you must find and return any treasure to Oldid Silverbeard, the noble of Irongate. Will you be able to find the vault and the treasure, let alone survive?

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 6.

214679.name: Downward
rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214679.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Scenario

From the introduction:

Are you up for a heroic adventure where you will travel deep into an abandoned mine located within the Lortmil Hills? Only the darkness below knows what you might encounter.

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214680.name: Tomb Raiders
214680.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Scenario

From the introduction:

You are asked to hunt down a group of tomb-raiding orcs. If you cannot reclaim the stolen treasure it may mean the destruction of the Principality of Ulek by the humanoids in the disputed lands.

A two-round adventure for characters levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214681.name: The Rescuers
214681.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Scenario

From the introduction:

While in Gryrax, you are recruited for a rescue mission. The trail starts with an opportunity to explore the coastal city of Gryrax before the PCs travel on to the disputed territory.

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214682.name: Spyder's Quest
214682.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Scenario

From the introduction:

Hired by the enigmatic man known as Spyder, you search the northern province of Ironhelm for signs of large man-killing spiders.

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214683.name: To Rejoin and Empire
214683.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Scenario

From the introduction:

Visiting the town of Greutam in the southwestern portion of the Principality of Ulek, you see firsthand the locals' desire to rejoin Keoland.

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214684.name: At the Edge of the Abyss
214684.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Scenario

From the introduction:

A regular market day in Gryrax quickly turns into an opportunity to explore the Azure Sea and beyond. Do these tranquil blue waters hold the secrets that could help turn the tide against the threat of the Pomarj?

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214685.name: Hoch Jebline
214685.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Scenario

From the introduction:

Two patrol units have been slaughtered and you are asked to seek out those who have done such an act.

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214686.name: Two Heads are Better than One
214686.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Scenario

From the introduction:

Traveling from Thunderstrike to Havenhill, you meet the horrors of another one's life.

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 6.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214687.name: Only the Beginning
214687.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Scenario

From the introduction:

Humanoid activity in the Disputed Territory has been on an increase and you are asked to help aid in numerous ways.

A highly combat intensive adventure intended for characters level 3 - 8.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214688.name: From All Sides
214688.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

You are asked to help defend the Principality of Ulek from the evil humanoid forces currently occupying the Disputed Territory.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 6.

214689.name: Further Downward
rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214689.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

You are asked to go deeper into Urgo's Mine, an abandoned mine located in the Lortmil Hills.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214690.name: Plea to an Empire
214690.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

You are asked to guard two ambassadors as they make their way from Gryrax to Keoland.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214691.name: Mountain Manor
214691.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Kidnappings are not unheard of, but the frequency of late has been alarming. Who has been taking merchants from the area around Havenhill, and why?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214692.name: From the Isles
214692.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

What adventure can you find on an early morning on the docks of Gryrax?

An adventure for characters level 3 - 8.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214693.name: Fort Stonewall
214693.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Fort Stonewall is under siege; can you make it inside to deliver some important news and much-needed supplies?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214694.name: Messengers
214694.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

You are asked to deliver an important message from Fort Stonewall to the city of Thunderstrike.

An adventure for characters level 3 - 10.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214695.name: Vanished
214695.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Something is just not right in the village of Dunharrow.

An adventure for characters level 3 - 10.

214696.name: Old Tales
rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214696.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

With the Lortmil Hills in grave danger of being taken control of by the Warlord’s minions, you are asked to seek out information about a legendary axe. One that an old, nearly forgotten tale states might be able to turn the tide against a great evil, but only if it makes its way into the hands of a true prince.

A Principality of Ulek regional adventure for APLs 2-10.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214697.name: Recon
214697.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

With the extreme chaos in the Disputed Territories, just how deep can you push yourselves for the sake of knowledge and information?

A Principality of Ulek regional adventure for APLs 4-10.

214698.name: Even Further Downward
rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214698.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

You are asked to go deeper into Urgo’s Mine, an abandoned mine in the Lortmil Hills.

A two-round continuous Principality of Ulek regional adventure for APLs 4-12.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214699.name: Wrapped in Death
214699.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

What dark secrets lie near the village of Cassius? Remnants of invaders and a mysterious mage have residents on the jump. Will you be able to unravel the truth, before being fitted for a burial shroud?

A Principality of Ulek regional adventure for APLs 4-12.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214700.name: Jailbreak
214700.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

It’s a beautiful day in Havenhill until the inmates break loose and wreak havoc on the city.

A Principality of Ulek regional adventure for APLs 2-10, and a sequel to ULP2-04: Mountain Manor.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214701.name: A Romantic Interlude
214701.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A routine scouting expedition goes horribly awry as a fierce storm ravages the countryside.

An adventure for PCs level 1-10.

214702.name: The Key
rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214702.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Can you find the key so that a legendary axe can make its way into the hands of the true prince?

An adventure for PCs level 3-12.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214703.name: Lost Dwarves
214703.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

You, a loyal adventurer to the Principality of Ulek, have been asked to participate in a top-secret mission.

What exactly does it entail?

A Royal Army and Mine Ranger adventure for PCs level 10-16.

214704.name: Even Further Downward Still
rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214704.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

With derro poison antidote supplies dwindling and sightings of derro near the village of Thrutch, you are asked to delve into unknown underground tunnels in search of a key ingredient. Can you successfully complete this mission without upsetting the balance down below?

A Principality of Ulek regional adventure for APLs 4-12.

214705.name: Axe of Corond
rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214705.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Can you retrieve a legendary axe for the true prince of the Principality?

A Principality of Ulek regional adventure for APLs 6-12, and a sequel to ULP3-07: The Key.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214706.name: Dark Trade
214706.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A frantic Mine Ranger returns with a horrific account of his team’s abduction while exploring an old mineshaft. What sinister forces are at work beneath Ulek’s Lortmil Hills?

A Principality of Ulek Regional adventure for APLs 2-10.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214707.name: Ring of Death
214707.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Death lingers near the village of Summervale. Are you able to destroy the ring of death, yet keep yourself and others from being a casualty in the maddening war with the Warlord?

A Principality of Ulek Regional adventure for APLs 4 - 12.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214708.name: Death to Undeath
214708.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

For nearly two years, those that have fallen in battle in the Disputed Territory have risen in an undead state. How much worse can it get before the Lortmil Hills fall under the control of the creature known as the Warlord?

A Principality of Ulek regional adventure for APLs 8-12.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214709.name: Just Bring It!
214709.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The time has come for the bold and brave heroes of the Principality of Ulek to step forward. Are you ready? If so, just bring it in this combat intensive scenario.

A Principality of Ulek regional adventure for APLs 12 - 18.

rpgseries: ULP - Living Greyhawk Ulek Regional Adventures
214710.name: Chasing Smoke
214710.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Principality of Ulek Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Congregation of the Hills calls out for aid. Agents of Ulaa have been murdered trying to regain ancient lost magics central to the defense and safety of the Lortmils. The divinations of the Keeper point like an arrow into the occupied territories. Will you respond and pursue the stuff of legend?

A Principality of Ulek regional adventure for APLs 2-12, and Part 1 of the Gems of Ulaa Series.

214712.name: Das neue Österreich Quiz
214712.description:
Das neue Österreich Quiz is a trivia game containing 220 question cards with three multiple choice answers each.

The game is played in turns. Every player has to answer a question but can choose not to hear the multiple choices. If he opts to do so, he gets 3 points for the correct answer or 0 points if he was wrong. If he chooses to use the multiple choice option, he gets 2 points for the correct answer, but if answered wrong, he gets another chance but then only 1 point is awarded for the correct answer.

The game ends at the end of a round in which a player collected 30 points. The player with the most points is the winner.

214713.name: Das neue Wien Quiz
214713.description:
Das neue Wien Quiz is a trivia game containing 220 question cards with three multiple choice answers each.

The game is played in turns. Every player has to answer a question but can choose not to hear the multiple choices. If he opts to do so, he gets 3 points for the correct answer or 0 points if he was wrong. If he chooses to use the multiple choice option, he gets 2 points for the correct answer, but if answered wrong, he gets another chance but then only 1 point is awarded for the correct answer.

The game ends at the end of a round in which a player collected 30 points. The player with the most points is the winner.

214716.description: Set of Swamp Raptors miniatures. This is a Gen Con Special containing three savage Swamp Raptors and rules and cards to add them to your games of Shadows of Brimstone.
214716.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Swamp Raptor Hunting Pack XL Enemy Set

214717.name: Tavern Keeper
214717.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




About the game
A good tavern is the heart and soul of a community - a place for drama and intrigue, shoddy deals and outrageous meals. A place for peasants to relax, travellers to rest and heroes to plan their next daring adventure. But what of the unsung heroes of it all - the tavern keepers?

In Tavern Keeper you manage a tavern, building, bartering, cooking and cleaning your way to success in a humorous fantasy world. Starting out with a shell of a tavern in the backwaters of the kingdom, you build rooms, place items, stock the larder and hire staff to satisfy the demands of the oddball locals and misfit heroes that stumble through your door. Run your business well and you’ll progress to larger taverns with more demanding patrons where you’ll need to expand your offerings to include new meals, drinks, rooms and services.

Feature Preview

- Build and run your own unique fantasy tavern.
- Hire, organize and manage your staff and keep them cheerful and efficient.
- Serve a wide variety of eccentric characters, from human peasants to orc nobility.
- Balance merchant supply, patron demand and larder stocks with a truly medieval storage system.
- Keep patrons satisfied with food, drink, services and entertainment as you build your reputation.
- Expand your kitchen to craft ever more exotic dishes.
- Optimize production workflows to stay a step ahead of the growing crowds.
- Plan carefully, spend your money wisely and keep an eye out for chaotic events that could drive you out of business.

Source: The Game Website.

214718.name: Citadel of Corruption
214718.description:
User Summary

Citadel of Corruption is a text adventure written in GAC by David Picking and Kevin Crampton. The game has a medieval setting. Published by Digital Dynamite.

214719.name: Super Star
214719.description:
User Summary
Just started up your own agency for show biz stars, you haven't been able to spot any talents yet, so one night you sit down and play H-Game, and end up with a surprise: When you finish the game, a pretty girl is in your bed.

You will tutor, and manage her in order to make her a super star in just three years.

214720.name: Human Interface: Nakamura Tower – AI Human Hybrid Form 04
214720.description:
The results of physical test highly above estimated parameters. Speed, reflex and basic tactical abilities, all on the upper end of scale. The simulations proved extreme aptitude for infiltration and assassination.

The instability of behavioral interface was observed, confirmed accidents of ignoring the orders despite of active connection. Thorough modification of control protocols is highly recommended...

Notes of senior specialist Jimmie Asturo on the forth prototype of AIHH, written the day before the funds had been withdrawn and project taken on hold.

Box content:

1 metal miniatures
1 ID cards
2 weapon and gear cards
1 plastic bases

214721.name: Human Interface: Nakamura Tower – RAID44 Officer Santiago & Hirayatsu cyberdog
214721.description:
I've seen guys like these, hardwired from head to toes, stoned with battle drugs blocking all superior human feelings. Invulnerable. Immortal. Not dreaded by our armors, weapons, combat programs. And all those tough guys, regretted not wearing brown pants the same minute I had unleashed my beauty

Officer Santiago on new model of Hirayasu D9

Box content:

2 metal miniatures
2 ID cards
2 weapon and gear cards
2 plastic bases

214722.name: The Ytroth Larvae of the Scarsea Cliffs
214722.description:
From the publishers blurb:

A ragtag group of adventurers delve into the mouth of one of The Ytroth Larvae of the Scarsea Cliffs seeking antideluvian treasure from underground civilizations! The Ytroth Larvae of the Scarsea Cliffs is a low-power funnel-like 2 page fantasy dungeon perfect for keeping as a backup plan or one-shot in your GM notebook. It prints cleanly onto both sides of a 8.5" by 11" sheet of paper. The Dungeon is written in an open-ended fashion that can easily be adapted on the fly to fit any fantasy setting or ruleset.

Prove your worth as an adventurer and break free from the shackles of serfdom
Pry loose gems from the jaws of a giant monster
Fight tooth and nail with the beasts contained within the larva's belly for treasure

214723.name: The Investigation Begins (4E)
214723.description:
From publisher blurb:

These five adventures are the first act of a steam & spell campaign for Dungeons & Dragons 4th edition.

Steam and soot darken the skies above the city of Flint, and the choking products of its industrial forges sweep from the majestic harbor to the fey rainforests that dot its knife-toothed mountains. The Unseen Court, the Great Hunt, and the many spirits of the land no longer receive tribute, but they cannot enter these new domains of steam and steel to demand their tithe. The impoverished workers who huddle in factory slums fear monsters of a different breed, shadowy children of this bleak urban labyrinth.

Times are turning. The skyseers – Risurs folk prophets since their homeland’s birth – witness omens in the starry wheels of heaven, and they warn that a new era is nigh. But what they cannot foresee, hidden beyond the smog of the night sky, is the face of this coming era, the spirit of the age. The zeitgeist.

This tome contains Act One of ZEITGEIST: The Gears of Revolution, a cinematic adventure path designed for experienced Dungeon Masters (also available for the Pathfinder RPG). These five 'steam and spell' adventures will take your party - members of the Royal Homeland Constabulary - from 1st to 11th level as they solve murders, engage in magical spycraft, and unearth villainous conspiracies. Take a step away from traditional fantasy, and play a part in shaping the coming age!

214724.name: The Investigation Begins (Pathfinder)
214724.description:
From publisher blurb:

These five adventures are the first act of a steam & spell campaign for the Pathfinder RPG.

Steam and soot darken the skies above the city of Flint, and the choking products of its industrial forges sweep from the majestic harbor to the fey rainforests that dot its knife-toothed mountains. The Unseen Court, the Great Hunt, and the many spirits of the land no longer receive tribute, but they cannot enter these new domains of steam and steel to demand their tithe. The impoverished workers who huddle in factory slums fear monsters of a different breed, shadowy children of this bleak urban labyrinth.

Times are turning. The skyseers – Risurs folk prophets since their homeland’s birth – witness omens in the starry wheels of heaven, and they warn that a new era is nigh. But what they cannot foresee, hidden beyond the smog of the night sky, is the face of this coming era, the spirit of the age. The zeitgeist.

This tome contains Act One of ZEITGEIST: The Gears of Revolution, a cinematic adventure path designed for experienced Game Masters. These five 'steam and spell' adventures will take your party - members of the Royal Homeland Constabulary - from 1st to 8th level as they solve murders, engage in magical spycraft, and unearth villainous conspiracies. Take a step away from traditional fantasy, and play a part in shaping the coming age!

214725.name: The Grand Design (Pathfinder)
214725.description:
From publisher blurb:

These four adventures are the second act of a steam & spell campaign for the Pathfinder RPG.

A conspiracy has been unmasked, and though their plans were disrupted, the fallout has gripped the attention of the world. After decapitating a cell of conspirators in their home city of Flint, royal constables of the nation Risur managed to drive away the 300-ft. tall metal titan that the villains had crafted in the shadows. Now it tromps its way across the borders of great nations, unstoppable, out of control, but such a tempting prize for whosoever can seize its reins.
Spymasters and their agents set to work to take advantage of this pivotal opportunity, zealots expose shameful secrets, and would-be tyrants take their shot to overturn the old order. But the conspiracy, though stymied, is not defeated, and if they complete their masterstroke, it will be they who choose the face of this new era, the spirit of the age. The zeitgeist.
This tome contains Act Two of ZEITGEIST: The Gears of Revolution, a cinematic adventure path designed for experienced Game Masters. These four adventures witness your party - members of the Royal Homeland Constabulary - rise from 9th to 15th level as they thwart the worldwide machinations of a conspiracy known as the Obscurati. Take a step away from traditional fantasy, and play a part in shaping the coming age!

214726.name: The Grand Design (4E)
214726.description:
From publisher blurb:

These four adventures are the second act of a steam & spell campaign for Dungeons & Dragons 4th Edition.

A conspiracy has been unmasked, and though their plans were disrupted, the fallout has gripped the attention of the world. After decapitating a cell of conspirators in their home city of Flint, royal constables of the nation Risur managed to drive away the 300-ft. tall metal titan that the villains had crafted in the shadows. Now it tromps its way across the borders of great nations, unstoppable, out of control, but such a tempting prize for whosoever can seize its reins.
Spymasters and their agents set to work to take advantage of this pivotal opportunity, zealots expose shameful secrets, and would-be tyrants take their shot to overturn the old order. But the conspiracy, though stymied, is not defeated, and if they complete their masterstroke, it will be they who choose the face of this new era, the spirit of the age. The zeitgeist.
This tome contains Act Two of ZEITGEIST: The Gears of Revolution, a cinematic adventure path designed for experienced Game Masters. These four adventures witness your party - members of the Royal Homeland Constabulary - rise from 11th to 20th level as they thwart the worldwide machinations of a conspiracy known as the Obscurati. Take a step away from traditional fantasy, and play a part in shaping the coming age!

214727.name: The Age of Reason (Pathfinder)
214727.description:
From publisher blurb:

These four adventures are the third act of a steam & spell campaign for the Pathfinder RPG.
Darkness falls across the world, and the once-hidden Obscurati proclaim a new Age of Reason. As they seize power, however, prophecies of diverse doomsdays come to life, ancient titans rouse from slumber, and a vast and hazy form in the heavens above looms ever closer.
Now the spies and investigators of Risur must shoulder the defense not just of their nation, but all the world's peoples. The power of fate has been undone, and now it is their free will that will determine the course of the future, the spirit of the age. The zeitgeist.
This tome contains Act Three of ZEITGEIST: The Gears of Revolution, a cinematic adventure path designed for experienced Game Masters (also available for the Dungeons & Dragons(R) 4th edition RPG). Witness your party - members of the Royal Homeland Constabulary - wield the epic power of 16th through 20th level characters as battle the dominion of the Obscurati to retake control of their world. Take a step away from traditional fantasy, and lead the charge of the revolution!

214728.name: Night Camps
214728.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explorer: Night Camps is a set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game.

Explorer: Night Camps is a standalone set, comprising 8 10x12 battlemaps. Each tile depicts a different and unique night time campsite, perfect for every time your party decide to settle down for the night.

Forest Clearing: A campsite in the middle of a forest, surrounded by trees.
Road side: A small campfire by the side of a cobbled road.
Ruins: A sheltered spot in the shadow of a ruined wall.
Riverside: A campfire and roast near a river
Cave: A rough camp in the entrance to a cave
Icy Wastes: Warmth and rest in the bleak winter
Oasis: A simple camp near an oasis in the desert
Dungeon: Stopping to rest in the depths of a dungeon




Please Note: These maps are not geomorphic, and not intended to match up perfectly with anything. They are intended as standalone battlemaps

214729.name: Tome of Madness
214729.description:
From publisher blurb:

Something Crazy for your Campaign

Tome of Madness is the definitive source for dealing with maniacal madmen and deranged villains, but also for haunted heroes and their afflicted allies whose minds have been pushed past the breaking point. This lavishly detailed tome examines the nature of mental maladies from aphasia and amnesia to phobias, tics, delusions, dyspraxia, and hysterical blindness. With over three dozen forms of insanity with varying severity and symptoms, you'll find lesser ailments that may accompany your heroes throughout their lives, as well as devastating delusions that can shatter a character's world.

Tome of Madness goes a step further, with abundant information on the treatment of madness, including the use of alchemy and magic (and even occult faith healing) to calm the disturbed mind. Whether insanity is purely biologic or an element of addiction, brought on by gradual decline or a sudden, sharp break, you will find a wealth of information for incorporating insanity into your Pathfinder campaign in an in-depth way that does not degenerate into simple stereotypes or leave you with an unplayable character but gives your heroes and villains alike some real depth in their disturbia! Grab this 32-page Pathfinder accessory today and Make Your Game Legendary!

214730.name: The Fairy Spell Book
214730.description:
From publisher blurb:

Where did Fairies and Pixies come from? What makes their magic different from all other magic on Trollworld?

Find out in the Fairy Spell Book.

214731.name: Nekora
214731.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ruin race for use with Castles & Crusades.

214732.name: Infowar: A Singularity System Module
214732.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Infowar Singularity System Module Includes:

New rules for cybercombat and hacking
Direct Neural Interfaces, TacNets, and more
Rules for cutting edge technology, and cyberwarfare between capital ships!

214734.name: Psicrystals Expanded
214734.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unlock new options for the iconic crystalline buddy of the psionics world - the psicrystal from Ultimate Psionics. Whether storing psionic power in the psicrystal, embedding it into a creature, or turning it into a weapon, the psicrystal gains all new options for use in the Pathfinder RPG.

Psionics Augmented: Psicrystals Expanded includes six new advanced psicrystals, eleven new psicrystal-related feats, two new psicrystal related powers, a new aegis customization, a new soulknife blade skill, and an expanded list of psicrystal personalities.

If your psionic character uses a psicrystal, this book is for you!

214735.name: Mysterium: Game Day 2016 Promo Card
214735.description: This Mysterium vision card was a promotional item given to participants of Mysterium Game Day 2016. It is jokingly referred to as the "banana hammock" vision card.

214736.name: Dungeon Maker
214736.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pixel Loot - Dungeon Maker features 50 unique cards, each with a series of four interchangeable plot hooks. Drawing four Dungeon Maker cards and linking these plot hooks together will fill in the backstory for a random dungeon, and may even provide a motivation for your characters to explore it. More importantly, it gives you a series of ideas to trigger your own inspiration, keeping your stories fresh and your players engaged.

Each card has the following four dungeon hook elements:

Where is the dungeon located?
Who built it?
For what purpose?
What happened to the builders?




In addition, along the bottom of each Dungeon Maker card is a series of four icons that help you randomize your dungeon experience. Each card has a retro pixel art icon (in keeping with the Pixel Loot theme) to represent the following variables:

How many more exits are in this room (between 0 and 3)?
What kind of passage is each exit (10 possibilities: locked door, barred door, secret door, etc)?
What kind of trap protects this door or chest (7 possibilities: spike trap, falling rocks, poison, etc)?
What might players have to deal with in this room (10 possibilities: spider webs, green slime, an encounter, a chest, etc)?

214737.name: Racial Armaments
214737.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pixel Loot - Racial Armaments contains 30 weapons found on mundane equipment tables, functionally similar to Pixel Loot - Arms & Armor, but with a visual flavor and new descriptive text to give the feel of weapons and armor used by elves, dwarves, and orcs. Perfect for giving your campaign or more magical feel, and making common weapons like longswords and battleaxes come up more often in random treasure card draws.

214738.name: Art Objects
214738.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pixel Loot - Art Objects contains 10 unique items your players are likely to find in a typical treasure hoard, with a variety of values.

214739.name: Trade Goods
214739.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pixel Loot - Trade Goods contains 20 unique items that represent valuable commodities in a medieval style world. These can be great story-building rewards for players bored with chests full of gold. Can the players find a buyer for a herd of goats? The coffee beans and tea leaves they found in a shipwreck will bring them a lot of gold, but how do they transport it? These are also great rewards for low-level players who aren't ready for powerful magic items, but youncan easily tailor the quantities to match the appropriate challenge level. Each card includes the value per pound (and the weight of each animal, in the case of livestock). Just transporting and selling this stuff is an adventure in and of itself!

214740.name: Curious Effects
214740.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pixel Loot - Curious Effects features 30 unique cards, each with a different effect that can be applied to any item. As a dungeon master, you can use Curious Effects on pretty much anything your players find in a dungeon or chest. The effects range from magical to mundane, from magical properties to annoying odors. Some effects are readily apparent, and you can hand the player the card as a reminder of the effect. Some are more subtle, and you might want to keep them a secret until the player discovers it. Many effects will offer up questions or plot hooks that drive your players to explore the world in greater depth. Most importantly, Curious Effects gives you a series of ideas to trigger your own inspiration, keeping your stories fresh and your players engaged.

214741.name: Unknown Fate
214741.description:
User Summary

First person adventure Unknown Fate takes the player through a surreal landscape, offering both puzzles to solve and mysteries to unravel.

214742.name: Tartarus
214742.description:
The titular research vessel is on a collision course with Neptune. As a crew member, you must explore and fight your way through Tartarus, solving puzzles and repairing ship systems in your desperate life-and-death mission.

Source: The Game Website.

214743.name: Phoning Home
214743.description:
Phoning Home follows the misadventures of two lost robots in a sprawling open world. Portals, weather, rough terrain, and roaming enemies all threaten to end your duo's journey, so careful movements, teleporting, and attacks are key to survival.

Source: The Developer Website.

214744.name: Outlander: Destiny Dice
214744.description:
In Outlander: Destiny Dice, each player rolls the six custom dice. The goal is to roll Jamie and Claire characters; dark characters, like Black Jack Randall and Laoghaire MacKenzie, can ruin great rolls when they appear, while helpful characters like Jenny or Dougal, can save poor rolls. Players can alter destiny through action cards that allow players to re-roll dice or modify their roll.

After each player has rolled, players compare rolls. The best rolls advance their players forward on the destiny track, bringing Jamie and Claire closer together. The first player to get Jamie and Claire together wins the game.

Outlander: Destiny Dice contains:
6 oversized custom full color dice
40 Action Cards
4 Reference Cards
8 Markers (2 for each player)
A full-color rulebook

214745.name: Kill Doctor Lucky: Ebenezer Lucky Promo Card
214745.description:
Double sided (Happy & Grouchy) Promo Card included in GTM #202

Whenever a player discards the last point of luck on a murder attempt, they take the card. It is worth +2 to any murder attempt.

214746.name: Villages of Valeria: Rahdo the Guild Master Promo Card
214746.description: Promo Card included in Game Trade Magazine #202.

214747.name: Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Bass Orange Edition
boardgameintegration: Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Mega Man Blue
Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Proto Man Red
Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Mega Man Blue
Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Proto Man Red
214747.description:
Pixel Tactics is a head-to-head game of tactical combat for two players. Each player has an identical deck of 25 cards, from which they draft a leader. The leader's abilities alter vastly the strategy and playability of every other card in the deck, making the game playable in 25 different ways.

In the game, players take turns placing cards and attacking. Each card can activate in various ways, taking on offensive capabilities in the front rows of the unit, or support powers in the back rows. Cards can also be played as orders – powerful single-time effects that can turn the tide of battle.

Play continues until either player's leader is defeated. A typical game is best of three or five rounds.

Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Bass Orange Edition is a box containing two copies of all the unlocked stretch goals from the Mega Man Pixel tactics Kickstarter campaign, including all the social goals, bringing a total of 28 different new characters to the table! This is also playable on its own.

214748.name: Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Stardroids
boardgameintegration: Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Bass Orange Edition
Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Mega Man Blue
Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Proto Man Red
Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Bass Orange Edition
Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Mega Man Blue
Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Proto Man Red
214748.description:
